properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 11 at 1:27AM CST until January 11 at 2:15AM CST by NWS Shreveport LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Southern Webster Parish in northwestern Louisiana...
Southeastern Bossier Parish in northwestern Louisiana...

* Until 215 AM CST.

* At 127 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located near Haughton, or 7 miles southeast of Bossier City,
moving east at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* This dangerous storm will be near...
Haughton around 130 AM CST.
Doyline around 140 AM CST.
Sibley, Dixie Inn and Heflin around 150 AM CST.
Minden and Dubberly around 155 AM CST.

Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include
Curtis, Taylortown, Noles Landing, Lake Bistineau North, Sligo, Ogden
and Koran.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the
tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!

Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not
wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!

CMAMtext: NWS: TORNADO WARNING in this area til 2:15 AM CST. Take shelter now. Check media.
